snippet: The sudden adjournment raised the possibility of a major hiccup at the end of a six-week trial over the closing of access lanes to the George Washington Bridge....
abstract: Judge Susan D Wigenton, who is presiding over trial of Bridget Anne Kelly and Bill Baroni in George Washington Bridge lane closing case, abruptly adjourns court before lawyers on both sides begin their closing arguments; tells jury that, after discussing legal issue with both sides in chambers, it would be better to start closing arguments at later time.
lead_paragraph: The sudden adjournment raised the possibility of a major hiccup at the end of a six-week trial over the closing of access lanes to the George Washington Bridge.

headline.main: Judge in Bridge Case Abruptly Adjourns Trial Before Closing Arguments
headline.print_headline: Bridge Trial Is Abruptly Delayed Before Closing Statements

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
